trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Lynda.com | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Lynda.com | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Lynda.com with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Lynda.com with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Lynda.com
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Lynda.com

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524768).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524768).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Lynda.com.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Lynda.com.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Lynda.com tenant
trans-unit.target: A Lynda.com tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Lynda.com will be able to single sign into the application at your Lynda.com company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Lynda.com will be able to single sign into the application at your Lynda.com company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Lynda.com
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Lynda.com

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Lynda.com
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Lynda.com

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Lynda.com.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Lynda.com.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Lynda.com, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Lynda.com, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **Lynda.com**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **Lynda.com**.

trans-unit.source: Application Gallery
trans-unit.target: Application Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Lynda.com**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Lynda.com**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Lynda.com
trans-unit.target: Lynda.com

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Lynda.com with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Lynda.com with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT]In order to be able to configure single sign-on on your Lynda.com tenant, you need to contact first the Lynda.com technical support to get this feature enabled.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT]In order to be able to configure single sign-on on your Lynda.com tenant, you need to contact first the Lynda.com technical support to get this feature enabled.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Lynda.com** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Lynda.com** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Lynda.com** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Lynda.com** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **Lynda.com Sign In URL** textbox, type your Lynda.com tenant URL (e.g.: *https://shib.lynda.com/Shibboleth.sso/InCommon?providerId=https://sts.windows-ppe.net/6247032d-9415-403c-b72b-277e3fb6f2c8/&target=https://shib.lynda.com/InCommon*), and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **Lynda.com Sign In URL** textbox, type your Lynda.com tenant URL (e.g.: *https://shib.lynda.com/Shibboleth.sso/InCommon?providerId=https://sts.windows-ppe.net/6247032d-9415-403c-b72b-277e3fb6f2c8/&target=https://shib.lynda.com/InCommon*), and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure app URL
trans-unit.target: Configure app URL

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at Lynda.com** page, to download your metadata, click **Download metadata**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at Lynda.com** page, to download your metadata, click **Download metadata**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Send the downloaded metadata file to the Lynda.com support team.
trans-unit.target: Send the downloaded metadata file to the Lynda.com support team.

trans-unit.source: The Lynda.com support team does the Single Sign On configuration for you.
trans-unit.target: The Lynda.com support team does the Single Sign On configuration for you.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Lynda.com.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Lynda.com.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Lynda.com using the access panel, Lynda.com checks whether the user exists.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Lynda.com using the access panel, Lynda.com checks whether the user exists.

trans-unit.source: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Lynda.com.
trans-unit.target: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Lynda.com.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can use any other Lynda.com user account creation tools or APIs provided by Lynda.com to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can use any other Lynda.com user account creation tools or APIs provided by Lynda.com to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Lynda.com, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Lynda.com, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **Lynda.com **application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Lynda.com **application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign users
trans-unit.target: Assign users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
